IX.i.2.4.
a
.
When to Develop for Willful Misconduct
Pension is not payable for any condition due to the Veteran’s own willful misconduct.
Develop the willful misconduct aspect of an injury in a pension case
only
when the residual disability from that injury would be a material factor in the grant or denial of a claim.  If there is doubt on this point, obtain advice from the rating activity.
Generally, if the facts of record are relatively clear as to the innocent incurrence of an injury, suggesting no element of willful misconduct, do not develop for this aspect of the claim.
Example
:  Unless there is a reasonable probability of willful misconduct, the mere fact that the injury was incurred in an automobile accident is
not
sufficient reason to initiate development.
Reference
:  For more information on willful misconduct, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart iv, 1.C
, and
38 CFR 3.301
.
